p: A pulsating voltage method for relithiation was developed by Zhu et al. [ 220]. The spent cobalt oxide was exposed to a very short (500 ns) high-voltage pulse at a frequency of 150 Hz in a 0.1 M LiOH aqueous solution. Upon pulsed electrical discharge, the suspended LCO underwent a structural change, which fixed cation disordering accumulated during cycling and supposedly improved Li + intercalation properties. The resulting LCO did not reach a satisfactory electrochemical discharge capacity, at 127 mAh/g at 0.2 C [ 220].
